corrected_options.text: Oh, that's annoying. I'll have to come back into town to fetch it.
Everything had better still be in that bag, or there'll be trouble.
Thank goodness, it's still there. I was afraid I'd never see it again.
You must have known it was my bag. Why didn't you call me?
Thanks so much for calling. I hadn't even realised that I'd lost it.

questions.explanation: The response that expresses relief about finding the bag is the most appropriate, which is option C.

questions.question_text:

of nowhere at a very high speed and

You're a road hog! Go back to driving
school and learn how to drive properly.

Did you see that incredible car? I'd love
to buy myself one of those some day.

Wow, that was fast! He must be trying to
get to an appointment on time.

I'm so sorry, but there was nothing I
could have done to prevent the accident.

What an idiot! He's going to kill himself
or someone else with that reckless
driving.

questions.question_text:

Even if Mrs Bell didn't like you, I don't

influence the mark she gave.

If I were you, I would go and see the
principal immediately and let her mark
your essay instead.

questions.question_text:

If you ask me, better living conditions must be offered to these people coming from rural areas.

As far as I am concerned, housing, education and public transport are among the major setbacks
of life in the big cities.
The rural population of the country is increasing far more rapidly than that in the big cities.
First and foremost, we need to open up new areas of employment in the rural areas.

questions.question_text:
You are a bank manager and a friend of yours, who is a businessman, has come to you for

advice on where to invest. As there is a prevailing economic crisis that seems likely to last for

some time, you feel it would be unwise to make any specific recommendations for

investments. So you say:

options.text: In this time of recession, the only advice I can give you is to wait.
Some people are making overseas investments, but I don't think that's a good idea.

Since we are experiencing a temporary setback in the economy, why don't you channel your
resources into tourism?

In view of the rising prosperity, apparent at every level of society, why don't you put your money
into one of the big corporations?

Given the present economic circumstances, I think you're sure to make money in any sector you
invest in.

questions.question_text:

questions.question_text:
As an expert in international relations, a group of journalists have asked you to give your

opinion on the strained relations between the United States and China over the recent spy

plane crisis. You feel that it is too early to make a full assessment of the outcome of the crisis.

So you say:

options.text:
This is an unfortunate event which seems likely to have long-term damaging effects on the

It is clearly a very serious situation. However, it's surely better to wait a while before venturing to
comment on the international impact of it.
I think both countries should exercise discretion; and if they do so, the crisis will soon be resolved.
As far as I am concerned, this spy crisis is being grossly exaggerated by both sides.

If you ask me, both sides are equally to blame for the crisis which could prove a threat to world
peace.

dikkat; tefrik, ayırma

questions.question_text:
You are the defence lawyer in a case of a bank robbery. You believe that your client was not

The reasons for suspecting my client of the robbery are purely circumstantial: there is no reason to
